DA: N. Bedford man, in fit of rage, hurt girlfriend's baby

Ethen Harrison pleaded not guilty today to allegations that he attacked his girlfriend's nine-month-old daughter, who later died, according to prosecutors and court records.
 (Boston Globe, 3:30 p.m.)
  • Watch Prosecutor comments on allegations

Natick student computers fried after an attempt to uninstall anti-filtering app

Officials were stymied by a computer bug while trying to remove software that circumvents filters that block Facebook as well as gambling and porn sites. (Globe, 4 p.m.)

Mattapan massacre witness sentenced

Kimani Washington, who pleaded guilty to playing a role in the 2010 drug robbery that ended with four people murdered, was sentenced today. (Globe, 3:03 p.m.)

Murray: I'll return any improper donations

Lieutenant Governor Timothy Murray said he'll take responsibility if investigators find that he accepted donations that he should not have. (Boston Globe, 5:38 p.m.)
  • Watch Murray discusses campaign finance probe
  • 1/24 Regulators: Criminal probe needed | Discuss

Romney makes a visit to Washington

Mitt Romney attended a luncheon blocks from the White House, but skipped the inauguration, becoming the first losing candidate to do so since 1988. (Globe, 4:57 p.m.)

Temperatures in East Millinocket, Maine, dipped into the double digits below zero this week, with a wind chill that makes it feel closer to -30.
Opinion | JOAN WICKERSHAM

The joy of re-reading

One of life’s great joys is re-reading. The stories don’t get old; the books change because we change.
